topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: Managing the Domain

body.p: A domain is a high-level container for the projects, users, and groups that define administrative boundaries for management of those entities. A domain can represent an individual, company, or operator-owned space.
The admin user can use the dashboard to configure the domain by creating building blocks such as flavors and quotas, and managing availability zones and host aggregates.

section.title: Managing flavors for a domain
section.p: A flavor defines the compute, memory, and storage capacity of a virtual server that users can launch. As an administrative user, you can create, edit, and delete flavors.

section.title: Managing images for a domain
section.p: A virtual machine image is a single file which contains a virtual disk that has a bootable operating system installed on it.
As an admin, you can determine if an image is available only in the current project or to all projects in the domain (public).

section.title: Managing Availability Zone and Host Aggregates for a domain
section.p: Host aggregates are a mechanism to further partition an availability zone. Host aggregates provide a mechanism to allow administrators to assign key-value pairs to groups of machines.
Use the System panel in the Admin dashboard to modify the availability zones and aggregates for your domain.
